description:
Kagirinaki Tatakai is a vertically structured platform shooter. The player controls a character whose goal is to descend as deep as possible into a complex underground system. The protagonist is equipped with a jetpack (which allows him to hover in the air for a while), a laser gun with unlimited ammunition, as well as limited supplies of rockets and grenades. Rockets can be shot straight ahead, while grenades can be thrown down in curved trajectories. Various types of enemies, both stationary and moving, will try to stop the hero by shooting at him. The player character takes no damage from either physical contact with an enemy or falling.

The game's stand-out feature are destructible environments. Rockets and grenades can be used to destroy any part of the scenery, be it floors, platforms, or walls. The player character, however, cannot leave the screen horizontally; walking through a hole in the wall on either side makes him appear on the opposite one. Destroying solid structures can be used to bypass maze passages or gain a better angle for shooting.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting started. The enemy below readies his cannon. I answer by destroying the wall with the rocket
Hmm, these structures look pretty interesting...
Hey, guys... Come on... I'm happy to see you and all, but... it's getting crowded in here. Right? Right? Hehe...
...elementary, Watson! By blowing up the floor!

title: Kagirinaki Tatakai

description:
The protagonist of the game was sent on the spaceship Zeppelin to a supposedly deserted planet. However, upon entering its atmosphere his pod was shot by laser fire. Soon the hero discovers that the planet is populated by robots and controlled by the air defense computer. The protagonist has to explore the hostile world and survive.

Brain Breaker is a side-view game that incorporates elements of action and adventure-style gameplay. Much of the gameplay is dedicated to exploring environments, gathering clues and items that must be used on specific occasions in a puzzle-solving-like fashion. Hostile creatures appear sometimes and must be dealt with by using the few available weapons. It is also possible to communicate with some of the characters encountered in the game.
title: Brain Breaker

description:
Euphory is a medieval-themed action game with light role-playing elements. The protagonists of the game are the brother and sister Rafael and Falram. Their mother became gravely ill, and they have to travel to her homeland in order to find the rare medicine. The game can be played controlling either of the characters, or in a two-player mode where both are controlled cooperatively.

The game world consists of towns, where the player characters can buy weapons and equipment, and hostile areas. There is no experience points system, but defeated enemies award the player gold and healing items. Some areas also require the protagonist to jump and swim.
title: Euphory

description:
Legend says that the god Issural has imbued the magical stone Calvan with his powers. Two countries are ready to fight each other in order to possess the precious stone. However, it is ultimately up to a group of unknown adventurers to find it and perhaps put an end to the struggle.

Issural: The Story of Calvan is a medieval-themed fantasy role-playing game. Basic gameplay mechanics follow the Dragon Quest template, with overhead exploration, random enemy encounters, and turn-based combat. The game resembles the first Final Fantasy in requiring the player to create a party of four characters out of several available races and classes. Points can be distributed to increase the characters' attributes initially. Battles take place on separate top-down screens and feature the possibility to position characters before engaging in combat. There is a day and night cycle in the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Combat in a mountain area. Positioning

title: Issural: The Story of Calvan

description: The sequel to Bokosuka Wars, featuring all-new enemy characters, items and traps, as well as a more balanced level of difficulty. Gameplay-wise, it's mostly identical to the first game - you must walk 600 meters to reach the enemy castle and kill the Dragonet. The player controls three units: the King, Knight, and Pawn. When moving these units, you can either move your entire army at the same time, or move all of one type of unit. Only your own units can initiate battles. All units gain strength while fighting and after fighting a sufficient number of battles, Pawns and Knights will be promoted to stronger, golden forms of themselves. There are captive Pawns along the way that can be rescued to increase your ranks, but only Knights can break the gates in front of them. There's also barriers every 100 meters, which can only be broken by King Suren. The King is also the only one who can destroy large trees in some of the forest areas.

sample_screenshots.caption: New obstacle - River of Death, touching the water will kill all your guys (including the King)
Positioning a Knight or Pawn on these boxes turns them into Great versions (the yellow guys)

title: New Bokosuka Wars

description: A motorcycle game very much inspired by Sega's Hang-On, right down to the title. In a chase-view 3D mode, you ride a motor cycle at speeds up to 250 km/h, making sure not to slide out of the corners or collide with fellow competitors. The game runs over several courses, beginning with a series of test courses. A course editor is also included.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out on the test course
The second course features a stand

title: Hang On

description:
Long before Dr. Kawashima's Brain Training, there was the Atama no taisō (Brain gymnastics) series. Made up of three miniature games, the X1 version purports to train your abilities of reaction, memorisation and spatial thinking.

  • Limit 0.x s is a reaction game where you are presented with sixteen panels where a heart symbol appears at random intervals, upon which you must press a key before it disappears. Sometimes, a human figure appears instead, whereupon you mustn't press that key. Score is awarded according to how fast you press the key, with bonus scores if you mark rows or columns of panels.
  • Box 26 is a memory game where you must find the letters of the alphabet between 26 boxes in the correct order by moving a little human figure around the screen. The time limit is 300 seconds.
  • Block 888 presents a cube made up of 8 x 8 x 8 transparent blocks (512 in total), viewed from three axes. Some blocks are blue, and you must count those blocks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting out with a clear field
The cube seen from three directions

title: Atama no taisō

description: Rowdy Ball is a Breakout variant where you must bounce a ball against a wall, passing through rows of different kinds of food, which the ball eats. You are up against rice balls, deep fried shrimp, dumplings and all kinds of sushi. Apart from the ball and bat, there are also two catchers placed halfway between the bat and the foods.

sample_screenshots.caption: The ball is caught in one of the catchers

title: Rowdy Ball

description: Bakusou Buggy Ipatsu Yarou is, as the title suggests, a lightweight car racing game by Bothtec. In the game, players must go through all the checkpoints within the time limit in each round. Players also need to pay attention to how much fuel they have left, the obstacles in their way and avoid overheating their vehicle.
title: Bakusou Buggy Ipatsu Yarou

description: Trop Way is an action game where players control a blob that needs to solve a water shortage problem. The blob called Trop needs to move water barrels through a belt conveyor while avoiding enemies. Trop can jump and there are 120 levels to complete in the game.
title: Trop Way

description:
Gohst Town is a Japanese adventure game. You have crash-landed in a desolate, deserted town after the Cessna you were piloting had engine trouble. The Cessna is severely damaged and difficult to repair. You do find a car, but the key is missing. The objective of the game is to escape from the town. Several items can be found around the town that can be collected and need to be used in order to proceed.

There are basic room descriptions and the text commands are in very simple English. This has to be done in full sentences. (Example: 'OPEN CABINET') Movements can be done by typing F(ORWARD), B(ACK), L(EFT), R(IGHT), UP and DOWN. Once the car key has been found, you can start driving the car by pressing 8 (UP), 2 (DOWN), 4 (LEFT) and 6 (RIGHT). To be able to start the car, press 5, but if you want to stop the car, you have to press 1. By pressing 3 you can get out of the car when you arrive at one of the buildings.

In the adventure screen your current strength and thirst are displayed on the left of the screen. When driving the car, the screen is always in top view, showing the various stats such as gasoline, physical strength and thirst on the lower part of the screen. They will decrease over time, so gasoline, food and water must be sought to replenish them. If they run out, the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Intro with the title screen and credits.

title: Gohst Town

description: Super Frenel is a Dig Dug clone. Just like in that game here you need to defeat all enemies per stage, by either pumping them full of air with your air hose until they explode or crushing them underneath rocks.
title: Super Frenel

description: Star Dust is an action space shooter where your goal is to protect four planets in the solar system which is Earth, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn by beaming all the enemy spaceships and shoot down UFOs that will try to attack you by using your laser beam but don't use it too much because it will overheat, and you need to wait until it gets to green. If you shoot at the ally spaceship the UFOs will disappear temporarily and you won't be able to see where they will attack from. If you get hit by the UFO attacks, then it will destroy the satellite disk saying "DESTROYED!". You can get an extra if you reach 10000 points once all are gone then it's game over and the enemy has taken over all of the planets.
title: Star Dust

description: Dr. Slump Hashire! Senbei-san is an action running game where you play as Senbei Norimaki who runs with a kite in his hand who's on his way to meet up with his fiancé Midori Yamabuki at the end of the goal before the time runs out while avoiding Aho! Bird, Poop Boy (who comes out of the Aho! Bird), air vent and electric pole that will shock Senbei. He can recover some time by shooting a white bird with his laser gun and can jump over air vents that will let him take out the laser gun by pressing space or using left or right trigger on the joystick in order to shoot at the Aho! Bird and White Bird which turns them into PON. You speed up or slow down Senbei by pressing 4 and 6 to move while strolling through nine rounds and then the game loops. If you get hit by Poop Boy, trip over air vent, get electrocuted by electric pole, or the kite gets hit then the timer will go down fast and if it runs out then "Empty Full" which means that Senbei has ran out of time and breath. If all of his lives are gone then it is game over.
title: Dr. Slump Hashire! Senbei-san

description: Mimitan is an action maze game where you play as Mimitan - a rabbit in a maze land of Ramen Village. There are pictures dropped in the passageway and the objective is to pick them up and collect them in a specified order. He has to combine all of the 4 picture pieces in stage 1 then in stage 2 collect 8 picture pieces, and 16 picture pieces of the ice cream in stage 3. Twenty points will be added to Mimitan for each picture he picks up, and 30 points will be added when he arrives at the ♡ place. Mimitan also has to avoid Fox-san because if he runs into him, he'll be captured and if the fox catches him 4 times, it's game over. He can pick up an apple for 50 points, cherry for 100 points, and carrot for 200 points and swift footed. There is also a bonus stage which is like Amida lottery. Here, based on your decision, you will be able to save one of the rabbits that are stuck in a cage but if you accidentally reach Fox-san another one will be added in the next stage as an enemy or if getting to nothing results in no consequences.
title: Mimitan

description: Space Hamburger is a Space Invaders clone where the enemies have been replaced with hamburgers.
title: Space Hamburger
